description.narrative: The development objective of the proposed project is to increase power generation from renewable geothermal resources, and reduce local and global environmental impacts.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section I.A.2 of the Schedule to the PA | Description :Pertamina shall, throughout Project implementation,review, at least on an annual basis, the operations of PGE, and take all action necessary to ensure effective implementation ofPGE's financial plan referred to in Section II.C.4 and to ensure satisfaction of thefinancial performance test stipulated inSection II.C.5 of this Schedule. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.C.4 of Schedule 2 to the IBRD LA / Schedule 1 to the CTF LA | Description :The Borrower shall causePertamina to cause PGE and shall cause PLN to comply with the provisions of the Joint H2S Abatement Agreement, including withrespect to the necessary investments in abatement technology, particularly on the basis of the outcome of the monitoring of H2Semissions carried out by PGE and PLN pursuant to said Agreement. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I.E.12 of the Schedule to the PA | Description :Pertamina shall: (a) cause PGE to, & PGE shall, complywith the provisions of the Joint H2S Abatement Agmnt, incl. with respect to necessary investments in abatement technology,particularly on basis of the outcome of monitoring of H2S emissions carried out by PGE & PLN pursuant to said Agreement; and (b)provide, promptly as needed, upon request by PGE, any funds, facilities or other resources... | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Section I.E.13 of the Schedule to the PA | Description :PGE shall take all measures necessary on its part tocollect, compile, and submit to the Bank, as part of the Project Reports, information on the status of compliance with the JointH2S Abatement Agreement, giving details of: (a) measures taken in furtherance of said Agreement; (b) conditions, if any, whichinterfere or threaten to interfere with the smooth implementation of said Agreement; (c) .. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Section II.C.4 of the Schedule to the PA | Description :PGE shall furnish for review to WB and Pertamina, nolater than April 30 in each calendar yr throughout Project implementation, a 5-yr financial plan comprising forecast incomestatements, funds flow statements, and balance sheets for the ongoing FY and the ff. 4FY; and thereafter revise such plan and takeall measures required to ensure its implementation, based on WB and Pertamina's views. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section II.C.5(a) of the Schedule to the PA | Description :Except as the Bank shall otherwise agree, PGE shallproduce for each of its fiscal years after its fiscal year ending on December 31, 2010, total revenues equivalent to not less thanthe sum of its: (i) total operating expenses; and (ii) the amount by which debt service requirements exceed the provision fordepreciation. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Avoided local air pollution (NOX, SO2, TSP)

baseline.value: 0 tonnes of NOX0 tonnes of SO20 tonnes of TSP

target.value: 3,000 tonnes of NOX5,400 tonnes of SO22,500 tonnes of TSP

actual.value: 2555 tonnes of NOX, 4569 tonnes of SO2, 2156 tonnes of TSP

title.narrative: Maintain operation availability of geothermal power plants
Progress of EPC contract for Lahendong SAGS+power plant
Progress of EPC contract for UlubeluSAGS+power plant
New geothermal power generation capacity installed directly financed by the World Bank loan
Contribute towards PGE becoming a leading geothermal developer
Ensure technical, environmental and social protection in line with industry standards during project preparation.

baseline.value: Feasibility studies are under par of industry standards.

target.value: Feasibility studies meet good industry practice.

actual.value: Two FS completed meeting industry standards

title.narrative: Bid documents including FEED issued for one geothermal plant; Studies issued for new developments/investments
Yearly agreement reached between PGE and TCP Partner on support program
IT software purchased, installed, and being utilized by PGE staff

target.value: Software installed, utilized by PGE staff

actual.value: Software installed, utilized by PGE staff

title.narrative: World Bank approval of yearly training program

baseline.value: Training Program yet to be approved

title.narrative: Minimum of 40 staff trained in key workshops each year
